page.title: 10HALLATON CHARITABLE TRUSTS
page.content: There are two charitable trusts in Hallaton. The{Hallaton Charities}is an amalgamation of various trusts, some dating from the 1700's, set up for the benefit of the villagers. It owns six cottages in Hog Lane, and a small recreation area (complete with seats and rocking horse) in front. Until 1985,the street lighting in the village was paid for by the Charities. The{Stenning Charity,}named after a local benefactor Isabella Stenning, provides the spacious village hall, the main recreation ground and seven cottages the tenants of which, until recently, paid no rent. The trustees of both charities now meet jointly, at least four times a year. Money is still given to the sick, to children for school clothes, and, particularly at Christmas, to those who have fallen on hard times.
